etymology.description: A hand holding a stone blade, referring to a man working with a stone axe.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a hand grasping a stone axe, emblematic of early male labor and authority. The image narrowed in meaning over time to denote the male parent, hence 'father.'

examples.chinese: 我想念我的父亲(我想念我的父親)。
他是两个孩子的父亲(他是兩個孩子的父親)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì liǎng gè háizi de fùqīn.
examples.english: He is the father of two children.

examples.chinese: 每年父亲节(每年父親節)，我们为父亲做饭(我們為父親做飯)。
examples.pinyin: Měinián Fùqīnjié, wǒmen wèi fùqīn zuò fàn.
examples.english: Every Father’s Day, we cook for our father.
